intro: Stellera fargesii, commonly known as the Chinese starflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant features linear, hairy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers, which bloom in early summer, are white to pale yellow and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stellera fargesii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to cool, moist climates.
